solution_line_template: Leila and her friends will travel a total distance of {distance_one_way} x {round_trip_factor} = <<{distance_one_way}*{round_trip_factor}={total_distance}>>{total_distance} kilometers back-and-forth.
They will need {total_distance}/{kilometers_per_liter} = <<{total_distance}/{kilometers_per_liter}={gasoline_needed_liters}>>{gasoline_needed_liters} liters of gasoline for this trip.
So, they will pay ${cost_per_liter} x {gasoline_needed_liters} = $<<{cost_per_liter}*{gasoline_needed_liters}={total_gasoline_cost}>>{total_gasoline_cost} for the gasoline.
Thus, the first option will costs them ${option1_rental_cost} + ${total_gasoline_cost} = $<<{option1_rental_cost}+{total_gasoline_cost}={total_cost_option1}>>{total_cost_option1}.
Therefore, they can save ${option2_total_cost} - ${total_cost_option1} = $<<{option2_total_cost}-{total_cost_option1}={savings}>>{savings} if they choose the first option.
